definition: surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: In the Jin Dynasty(265-420), there was a man called Zu Ti. He was a farsighted man with great ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 晋代有一个人叫祖逖，他是个有远大抱负的人。

sentences.english: Chinese ancient landscape poetry came into being in the Jin Dynasty. It is the crystallization of poets natural aesthetic.
sentences.chinese: 中国古代山水诗形成于晋代，是诗人自然审美的结晶。

sentences.english: The author was Wang Xizhi, a calligrapher in Jin Dynasty in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 作者王羲之，中国古代晋代书法家。

sentences.english: Portrait of Wang Xizhi, the great Jin calligrapher, famed for his semi-cursive writing.
sentences.chinese: 图为最擅长写行书的晋代大书法家王羲之。

sentences.english: Jin Dynasty is the developing period of the study of ancient books edition.
sentences.chinese: 晋代是古籍版本学的发展时期。

sentences.english: My whole ambition is to serve my country and maintain its greatness.
sentences.chinese: 晋代有一个人叫祖逖，他是个有远大抱负的人。

sentences.english: Argumentation theory of the Jin Dynasty made tremendous progress, the number of critics increased, and research methods improved.
sentences.chinese: 晋代论说文文论较前一时期有了长足的进步。

definition: Song of the Southern dynasties (420-479), with capital at Nanjing/also known as Liu Song 劉宋|刘宋
Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties/generic term for historic period 220-589 between Han and Sui
Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
Gan Bao (?-336), Chinese historian and writer, author of In Search of the Supernatural 搜神記|搜神记[Sou1 shen2 Ji4]
Western Han Dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 前漢|前汉[Qian2 Han4], Former Han Dynasty
